newsitem.title: INDIA: India approves nearly $300 mln in FDI proposals.
newsitem.headline: India approves nearly $300 mln in FDI proposals.

text.p: India on Wednesday approved 62 foreign direct investment (FDI) proposals involving a total investment of 10.81 billion rupees ($301.96 million), the Industry Ministry said.

"The approved proposals cover various sectors including financial services, electronics, tourism, textiles, electrical and auto accessories, engineering and consultancy," the ministry said in a statement.
The approvals included a proposal of the U.S.-based Kellogg Corp to invest $12.57 million in a fully owned subsidiary to make breakfast cereals, the statement said.
A proposal by the World Recreation Centre to start a wholly-owned exclusive club and recreation facility with an investment of 3.5 billion rupees was also given a green signal, it said.
Germany's Henkel's proposal to increase its stake in Henkel Spic India Ltd, from 60 to 70 percent was also approved by the ministry.

A proposal of Hindustan Lever Ltd, a subsidiary of London-based Unilever Plc, to set up a yeast production unit in the western state of Maharashtra with an investment of 75 million rupees was also cleared.
Two power projects of Global Boards Ltd and Torrent Power and a proposal to set up an oil refinery by East Cost Petroleum were also approved by the government. ($1 = 35.8 rupees)
